Description: Stamp (vessel): mikyala. Measure of shelled vetch. Six line inscription. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 149; Miles, G.C. 1963. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ II (I. Benaki Museum). New York, 233. Cf. Miles, G.C. 1964. Early Islamic weights and measures in the Muntaza Palace, Alexandria. ‘Journal of the American Research Centre in Egypt’ III. Cairo, 31.
On this type and on a number of al-Manṣūr's other vessel stamps, among them OA+ 4070 1894,0309.5 and OA+ 4073, there is an unwanted tooth after the first 'mīm' of 'al-mu'minīn'.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (206)
